programme.title: Crazy Six
programme.desc: A turf war erupts in a futuristic, anarchistic Europe between rival crime families supplying weapons.

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."

programme.title: Impulse
programme.desc: A teenager (Kim Nicholas) is suspicious of a charming stranger (William Shatner) who's romancing her widowed mother (Jennifer Bishop).

programme.title: Emanuelle and the Last Cannibals
programme.desc: A hedonistic photojournalist and an anthropologist traverse the Amazon Jungle to unearth the origins behind a mysterious woman, reputed to have been raised by a cannibal tribe.

programme.title: Shocking Dark
programme.desc: A team of soldiers and civilians are sent to Venice to investigate the mysterious deaths of scientists who are trying to clean polluted waters.

programme.title: Black Brigade
programme.desc: A group of soldiers with no combat experience hold a World War II dam for their bigoted captain (Stephen Boyd).

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Exuma; Taj Mahal; actress Cicely Tyson, star of the motion picture, "Sounder."

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Guests include Tony Award-winning singer Linda Hopkins and the musical group Earth, Wind & Fire.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: The Spinners; The Jimmy Castor Bunch.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Stokely Carmichael, the revolutionary leader who created and promulgated the now historic cry of Black Power, talks of his current plans that will bring Blacks together.

programme.title: Crime Story
programme.desc: A former mob boss embarks on a deadly rampage of revenge after he becomes the target of a home robbery. However, when his family gets caught in the crossfire, he must finally face the consequences of his dark past.

programme.title: Brothers
programme.desc: An innocent black youth succumbs to the brutalities of prison after being duped into pleading guilty to robbery.

programme.title: Melinda
programme.desc: An ex-girlfriend (Rosalind Cash) and a karate class help a disc jockey (Calvin Lockhart) avenge his slain girlfriend (Vonetta McGee).

programme.title: Hot Potato
programme.desc: A karate expert (Jim Kelly) and two cohorts must save a senator's kidnapped daughter.

programme.title: Three the Hard Way
programme.desc: A record producer (Jim Brown), a PR man (Fred Williamson) and a black belt (Jim Kelly) in karate foil a racist plot to poison part of a city.
